sect1.title: Zend::registry()
sect1.para: Returns a value in the registry or the registry itself.
If the $index argument is NULL, the registry will be returned (a subclass ArrayObject.
If $index is a string, the value assigned to that index will be returned. If an object does not exist in the registry with that $index, a Zend_Exception will be thrown.
To quickly determine if an index is present in the registry, use Zend::isRegistered().
